page.title: 13Farms and Markets
page.content: Barley and wheat are the commonest cereals grown in the area plus a little maize. No oats or rye are grown and few potatoes. A lot of grass is grown for silage and hay. The price of milk has fallen so much that there are few dairy farms left. Most farms keep beef animals and sheep are increasing. There are lots of riding horses. Small farms tend to be bought up by bigger units. Farmers use contractors as well as their own machinery. Recent innovations include round bales of hay and straw which need no barns for storage. Silage is made in large black polythene bags. Bale handling has become more mechanised with bigger machinery which is electronically controled.
